text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with borscht braised beef short
ribs that's right i was going to call
this beet braised beef short ribs but
then I remembered people don't like
beets or at least they think they don't
like beets so I ended up going with
borscht braised instead but semantics
aside I thought this came out really
really good and fairly gorgeous to look
at if you ask me so let me show you how
to put this delicious dish together and
we'll start by seasoning our beef short
ribs and there they are those are never
not beautiful and we'll go ahead we'll
generously season both sides with kosher
salt as well as some freshly ground
black pepper and please notice those are
cut to about three inch pieces which i
think is your ideal braising length and
that's another reason you want to get
your meat from the butcher counter and
not just grab it out of the meat case
alright the butcher is more than happy
to cut that exactly how you want but
anyway we're going to season those
generously all over and then we'll head
over to the stove where as usual we're
going to brown these in a little bit of
vegetable oil over high heat and if we
have any kids watching out there don't
stick your hands in the pot like this
use tongs so you don't burn yourself why
was I doing it I'm not that smart so
please be careful and like I said we're
going to brown those up and then once we
think we have our beef Brown
sufficiently we'll remove that to a bowl
to reserved that while we cook our
onions and normally at this point we
would dump our onions in reduce the heat
and kind of cook these on medium until
they just turn translucent but not this
time we're gonna leave our heat on high
because we do need to get some color on
these onions so we'll cook those
stirring and they will go from
translucent to kind of golden brown and
you're probably thinking that's good
right there
no it's not we want these to go from
golden brown to gold and black and once
those have gone over to the dark side we
can go ahead and dump in our flour and
we'll stir that in and we'll cook that
for exactly one minute and if you're
worried those black pieces onion you're
going to give your dish and ah flavor
they won't but what they will do is
deepen the color of our sauce and when
you're talking about a sauce made with
beets that's important all right we
don't to be labeling over a pink sauce
it's not a good look
and after our flowers cook for about a
minute we'll go ahead and dump in our
stock or broth I'm using a roasted
chicken stock
but virtually any meat stock or broth
will do and once we've introduced our
liquid we'll go ahead and add the rest
of the ingredients which includes 1 bay
leaf as well as some celery and carrots
and then of course one of the stars of
the show the beets so I had two
relatively fat beets which I peeled and
cut into eighths and we'll go ahead and
we'll dump those in so we do want those
in relatively large pieces so they don't
disintegrate during the cooking so we'll
go ahead and we'll bring this up to a
simmer before we reintroduce our beef
short rib pieces and I decided to give
it one more shot of salt here we will
check and adjust at the end as usual but
we're fine to toss in a nice big pinch
here and then once that simmering we'll
go ahead and put our beef back in and
Nestle it down lovingly and we'll try to
make sure those are evenly distributed
or distributed and at this point we are
ready for the oven
so what we'll do is we'll cover this and
pop that to the center of a 325 degree
oven for two hours or until your meat is
tender and this is what mine look like
after the aforementioned hundred and
twenty minutes and we'll give that the
old poka poka and I said tender now
fallen off the bone all right some
people tend to cook these too long and
you can actually go too far in the meat
will start to get dry and chalky
so we'll just go until a knife slides in
fairly easily and of course if the meats
tender I bet you anything those beets
are going to be tender which they were
and at this point we're just about done
what we'll do is we'll transfer all that
meat and vegetables into our serving
platter and simply keep it warm while we
finish the sauce so all I want you to do
is turn your heat on to high and bring
this up to a boil and all we're going to
do here is reduce this by approximately
half until it sort of thickens up a
little bit and while that's happening if
you want you can skim that fat from the
top and along with your cardiologist I
do recommend doing that and by the way
we talk a lot about Fonz during these
videos but there's also something called
side Fond where stuff actually
caramelizes to the sides of the pot and
if you do want a little bit of extra
flavor which you should always want we
could just splash a little bit of the
liquid up on the sides and kind of rinse
that goodness down into our sauce I
think it's a nice little trick do you
decide you are the James Bond of your
side found and then once
sauce is reduced down to the perfect
viscosity as judged by you we will turn
off the heat and give it a little check
for seasoning and mine was just about
perfect except I decided it need a
little more salt and I bet yours
probably will too and once our sauce is
done we'll finish by labeling that over
our still warming vegetables and I don't
know about you but that is just one
beautiful sight and this would be the
perfect point to remind you of how we
blacken some of those onions earlier to
deepen the color of the sauce this is
why but anyway we'll spoon over that
sauce and then I'm going to garnish this
with a couple pieces of chive I know
there was none in the recipe but there
will be hang tight and my borscht
braised beef short ribs are done and
looking visually arresting if I do say
so myself
and in case you haven't noticed this is
quite the low carb dish although we are
going to serve it on mashed potatoes so
never mind and then keeping with the
borscht theme I garnished with some sour
cream and a nice big pinch of chives and
forget how good it looks
assuming you think it looks good that is
just one incredibly delicious bowl of
food we've got that tender succulent
meat as well as believe it or not tender
delicious beets and I will admit I'm not
a big beet guy by the way big guy worst
superhero ever but like I was saying I'm
not a huge fan of beets but in this they
really are fantastic that earthy
sweetness just really works here okay so
while most people claim not to like
beets I think it's mostly because
they've never had them in things like
this so I really do hope you give them a
chance and give this a try soon so head
over to food wishes calm for all the
ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
you
